title: Implement multi-account wallet connection model
description:
attached_molecule: wa-wisp-anr
attached_at: 2026-02-19T19:38:22Z
attached_args: NEVER use EnterPlanMode — it WILL freeze your session. Implement directly with TDD. This is Phase 2 (P0) of multi-wallet multi-account architecture (en-fr0z). Update @cygnus-wealth/data-models to latest version first. Reference EnterpriseArch/mayor/rig/en-fr0z-multi-wallet-multi-account-architecture.md sections 1 and 3. Unit tests only, no E2E. START CODING IMMEDIATELY.
dispatched_by: mayor

Phase 2 of en-fr0z (multi-wallet multi-account architecture). Depends on Phase 1 (da-x33l, now merged in data-models).

IMPLEMENT:
1. Account accumulation model — on connectWallet(), store initial accounts from eth_requestAccounts. On accountsChanged, ADD new accounts to the list (never replace). Track isActive flag for currently selected account in provider.
2. Watch address management — addWatchAddress, removeWatchAddress, updateWatchAddress. WatchAddress entries are independent of wallet connections. AccountId format: watch:{checksummedAddress}.
3. Account group CRUD — createAccountGroup, updateAccountGroup, deleteAccountGroup. Groups reference AccountIds from any connection or watch addresses.
4. Session persistence with schema versioning — persist WalletConnections + WatchAddresses + AccountGroups to encrypted local storage. schemaVersion field (version 2 for new model). On restore: re-request accounts from provider, merge with persisted list, mark stale accounts.
5. Updated WalletConnectionContract — all commands and queries from en-fr0z spec section 3 (connectWallet, disconnectWallet, setConnectionLabel, setAccountLabel, setAccountChainScope, removeAccount, addManualAccountToConnection, watch address commands, group commands, all queries, all events).
6. Updated WalletIntegrationContract — getTrackedAddresses returning TrackedAddress[], getTrackedAddressesByChain, getTrackedAddressesByWallet, getTrackedAddressesByGroup, getAccountMetadata. Events: onAddressAdded, onAddressRemoved, onAddressChainScopeChanged.
7. Multi-provider conflict resolution — same address in multiple connections gets distinct AccountIds. Both tracked independently.

Update @cygnus-wealth/data-models dependency to latest version with the new identity types. See EnterpriseArch/mayor/rig/en-fr0z-multi-wallet-multi-account-architecture.md sections 1, 3 for full spec. Follow TDD.

title: E2E: review existing tests against enterprise strategy, document
description:
attached_molecule: wa-wisp-dpt
attached_at: 2026-02-15T05:45:19Z
dispatched_by: mayor

Enterprise E2E strategy (enterprise-arch/e2e-testing-strategy.md) confirms WalletIntegrationSystem E2E tests are functional. Action items:

1. Review existing E2E tests against enterprise-defined scenarios: MetaMask detection/connection (P0), chain switching (P0), multi-chain balance fetch (P1), wallet disconnect/reconnect (P1), provider not available (P1), multiple provider support (P2)
2. Add any missing P0/P1 scenarios
3. Ensure vitest.e2e.config.ts follows enterprise standard (jsdom env for mock-based, Puppeteer for browser injection)
4. Standardize npm script: test:e2e
5. Document E2E strategy in repo ARCHITECTURE.md — which scenarios apply, infrastructure setup, how to run locally, rig-specific considerations
6. All tests must pass: npm run build && npm test && npm run test:e2e

title: Fix WIS PR #4 lock file and publish v1.1.1
description:
attached_molecule: wa-wisp-t22
attached_at: 2026-02-17T18:19:39Z
attached_args: SKIP PLAN MODE. Implement directly. Checkout the EXISTING remote branch polecat/obsidian/en-p3tg@mlqx6uyl (git fetch origin && git checkout polecat/obsidian/en-p3tg@mlqx6uyl). Delete package-lock.json, run npm install to regenerate it, then push. Wait for CI to pass. Once CI green, merge PR #4 via gh pr merge 4 --squash. Then create tag v1.1.1: git tag v1.1.1 && git push origin v1.1.1. Check that the publish workflow runs and succeeds. Do NOT use EnterPlanMode.
dispatched_by: mayor

PR #4 (branch polecat/obsidian/en-p3tg@mlqx6uyl) on Cygnus-Wealth/wallet-integration-system has CI failing because package-lock.json references reusify@1.1.1 which does not exist on npm. Fix: checkout the PR branch, delete package-lock.json, run npm install to regenerate it, push. Once CI passes, merge PR #4. Then create tag v1.1.1 to trigger the publish workflow. Verify publish succeeds on npmjs.com.
